net.kreatious.pianoleopard.midi.sequencer

Class OutputModel

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.kreatious.pianoleopard.midi.sequencer.OutputModel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AutoCloseable

    public class OutputModel
extends Object
implements AutoCloseable
    Model for the MIDI output sequencer, allows controllers to listen for events.
    Author:
    Jay-R Studer

    • Constructor Detail

      • OutputModel

        public OutputModel(net.kreatious.pianoleopard.midi.sequencer.SequencerFactory sequencerFactory)
            throws MidiUnavailableException
        Constructs a new OutputModel with the specified initial state.

        The output model is initially unconnected to any MIDI devices. After construction, it is expected that an output device will be set by the consumer.

        Parameters:
        sequencerFactory - A factory for producing the Sequencer, such as SystemSequencerFactory.
        Throws:
        MidiUnavailableException - if the MIDI system is unavailable.

    • Method Detail

      • setOutputDevice

        public void setOutputDevice(MidiDevice output)
                     throws MidiUnavailableException
        Reconnects the sequencer to a different MIDI output device.
        Parameters:
        output - the new output MIDI device to reconnect to
        Throws:
        MidiUnavailableException - if the MIDI system is unavailable.

      • start

        public void start()
        Starts playback of the currently loaded MIDI file.

        Any registered start listeners will be called with the last opened MIDI sequence.

      • setPlayAlong

        public void setPlayAlong(boolean playAlong)
        Sets if active tracks are not muted.
        Parameters:
        playAlong - true if tracks are not to be muted, otherwise false.

      • setTempoFactor

        public void setTempoFactor(float factor)
        Adjusts the tempo of played back sequences.

        Values higher than 1.0 are faster than normal, less than 1.0 are slower than normal. A value of 1.0 indicates that the regular tempo should be applied. Tempo factors do not affect the microsecond values of MIDI events.

        Parameters:
        factor - the tempo factor to set

      • setCurrentTime

        public void setCurrentTime(long time)
        Seeks the sequence to the specified time
        Parameters:
        time - the time in microseconds to seek to

      • openMidiFile

        public void openMidiFile(File midi)
                  throws IOException
        Parses a MIDI file and prepares it for playback.

        Any registered start listeners will be called with the parsed sequence. The file of the parsed sequence will be the specified MIDI file.

        Parameters:
        midi - the MIDI file to open
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs

      • addOutputDeviceListener

        public void addOutputDeviceListener(Consumer<? super MidiDevice.Info> listener)
        Adds a listener to notify when the output device has changed.
        Parameters:
        listener - the listener to add

      • addStartListener

        public void addStartListener(Consumer<? super ParsedSequence> listener)
        Adds a listener to notify when a parsed MIDI file is started from the beginning.
        Parameters:
        listener - the listener to add

      • addPlayListener

        public void addPlayListener(Runnable listener)
        Adds a listener to notify when a parsed MIDI file is started from the beginning.
        Parameters:
        listener - the listener to add

      • addCurrentTimeListener

        public void addCurrentTimeListener(LongConsumer listener)
        Adds a listener to notify when the current playback time in microseconds has changed.

        This listener is called asynchronously several times per second for the lifetime of this object from a different thread than the one which invokes this method.

        Parameters:
        listener - the listener to add

      • sendMessage

        public void sendMessage(MidiMessage message)
        Sends a MIDI message to the output.
        Parameters:
        message - the MIDI message to send to the connected output device

           throws InterruptedException
        Specified by:
        close in interface AutoCloseable
        Throws:
        InterruptedException
